How can I provide legal advice to clients without being a qualified lawyer?

You can't.  Providing legal advice without the proper qualifications is illegal and unethical in almost every jurisdiction.  Doing so can result in serious consequences, including hefty fines and even jail time.  You risk harming your clients by giving them incorrect or incomplete information that could negatively impact their case.  Stick to referring clients to qualified legal professionals.
